unnormalised: Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Intensified Across Key Sectors
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Intensified Across Key Sectors

unnormalised: New Delhi: Increased scrutiny marks the current landscape of manufacturing as companies across India intensify vendor audits. The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) reports a 20% rise in scheduled audits compared to last year, driven by concerns over quality control and supply chain resilience.
normalised: New Delhi: Increased scrutiny marks the current landscape of manufacturing as companies across India intensify vendor audits. The Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) reports a twenty percent rise in scheduled audits compared to last year, driven by concerns over quality control and supply chain resilience.

unnormalised: Major players in the automotive and electronics sectors, particularly in Chennai and Pune, are conducting comprehensive audits of their suppliers. These audits cover ethical labour practices, environmental compliance, and adherence to ISO 9001 standards.

unnormalised: “Maintaining quality, especially during peak festival seasons like Onam when demand for products skyrockets, is crucial,” stated Mr. Sharma, Head of Procurement at Bharat Electronics Ltd. He added that recent audits uncovered discrepancies at a vendor supplying components costing Rs. 5 lakhs, forcing them to temporarily halt deliveries.

unnormalised: The audits also aim to ensure traceability and prevent counterfeit components from entering the supply chain. Many firms now require suppliers to maintain detailed records, including origin of materials and certifications, stretching back 3 years. Food processing units are similarly tightening controls, aiming to ensure hygiene standards for ingredients, vital for avoiding foodborne illnesses, especially when preparing popular dishes like biryani for mass consumption. Several auditors have logged travel over 1500 km in the past quarter alone. These enhanced checks contribute significantly to bolstering brand reputation and customer trust.
